meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a book.
meanings.sent1: The library had a booksy atmosphere with shelves full of old books.
meanings.sent2: Her room was so booksy, with bookshelves covering every wall.
meanings.sent3: The booksy decor made the room feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a booksy quality, as if each word was carefully written on a page.
meanings.sent5: The booksy scent of paper and ink filled the air, creating a nostalgic feeling.

meanings.sent1: She was a booksy girl, always carrying a book wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The booksy student spent hours in the library, lost in different stories.
meanings.sent3: His friends teased him for being too booksy, but he didn't mind.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a booksy excitement whenever she talked about her favorite novels.
meanings.sent5: The booksy smile on her face showed her love for reading and learning.

meanings.sent1: The booksy event at the bookstore attracted many avid readers.
meanings.sent2: His job at the publishing company was very booksy, dealing with manuscripts all day.
meanings.sent3: The booksy discussion among book club members was lively and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The booksy world of literature opened up new horizons for the young writer.
meanings.sent5: Her passion for all things booksy led her to pursue a career in the literary field.
